item.title: GTC felt more bullish than ever, but Nvidia’s challenges are piling up
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet, Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Nvidia took San Jose by storm this year, with a record-breaking 25,000 attendees flocking to the San Jose Convention Center and surrounding downtown buildings. Many workshops, talks, and panels were so packed that people had to lean against walls or sit on the floor — and suffer the wrath of organizers shouting commands to get […]

item.title: Apple faces lawsuit over Apple Intelligence delays
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Apple has been sued in federal court over what plaintiffs allege is false advertising of several Apple Intelligence features. Filed Wednesday in U.S. District Court in San Jose, the suit seeks class-action status and damages on behalf of those who purchased Apple Intelligence-capable iPhones and other devices. Plaintiffs claim that device owners haven’t received the […]

item.title: Federal judge blocks DOGE’s access to Social Security Administration’s banks of personal information
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The order accused DOGE of engaging in a "fishing expedition" at the federal agency.

item.title: Apple is reportedly losing $1B per year on its streaming service
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Apple is losing more than $1 billion per year on its streaming service, Apple TV+, according to a new report from The Information. Apple TV+ is the only service in Apple’s portfolio that isn’t profitable, the report reveals. The company has spent around $5 billion on content each year since the streaming service launched in […]

item.title: A high schooler built a website that lets you challenge AI models to a Minecraft build-off
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: As conventional AI benchmarking techniques prove inadequate, AI builders are turning to more creative ways to assess the capabilities of generative AI models. For one group of developers, that’s Minecraft, the Microsoft-owned sandbox-building game. The website Minecraft Benchmark (or MC-Bench) was developed collaboratively to pit AI models against each other in head-to-head challenges to respond […]

item.title: North Korea launches new unit with a focus on AI hacking, per report
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: North Korea is reportedly launching a new cybersecurity unit called Research Center 227 within its intelligence agency Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB).

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow says Goop is growing just fine
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Gwyneth Paltrow gave an update on her company Goop in a cover story for Vanity Fair. Paltrow founded the lifestyle brand Goop in 2008 and it has raised more than $140 million from investors including Greycroft and G9 Ventures, according to PitchBook. The brand is often regarded as one of the first examples of a […]

item.title: Perplexity is reportedly in talks to raise up to $1B at an $18B valuation
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: AI-powered search startup Perplexity is said to be in early talks to raise up to $1 billion in a new funding round valuing the startup at $18 billion. Bloomberg, citing a person familiar with the matter, reported on Thursday that Perplexity’s annual recurring revenue has now reached $100 million. Perplexity’s valuation has soared in recent […]

item.title: Apple puts Vision Pro exec in charge of Siri in exec shakeup
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: As Apple’s Siri comes under attack for failing at the most basic queries, the company is shaking up leadership in charge of Apple’s AI features for Siri. According to Bloomberg, Apple CEO Tim Cook is installing Mike Rockwell, the current VP of the Vision Products Group (the team behind the Vision Pro), to head up […]

item.title: Next Insurance gets scooped up by Munich Re for $2.6B
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description: Germany’s Munich Re has signed a definitive agreement to acquire digital insurance company Next Insurance for $2.6 billion, the firms announced on Thursday. Founded in 2016, Palo Alto-based Next Insurance is focused on providing insurance to small-to-medium-sized businesses. It was last valued at $2.5 billion in late 2023 when it raised $265 million. Next Insurance’s […]

item.title: Tesla Superchargers: GM, Ford, Rivian, and other EV brands with access
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: EV owners of GM vehicles like the Chevrolet Silverado EV and Cadillac Lyriq will now officially have access to Tesla’s Superchargers.

item.title: AI’s answers on China differ depending on the language, analysis finds
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: It’s well established that AI models developed by Chinese AI labs like DeepSeek censor certain politically sensitive topics. A 2023 measure passed by China’s ruling party forbids models from generating content that “damages the unity of the country and social harmony.” According to one study, DeepSeek’s R1 refuses to answer 85% of questions about subjects […]

item.title: Honda and Acura EV owners to gain access to Tesla Superchargers this June
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Honda and its luxury brand, Acura, are set to join the growing list of automakers providing EV owners access to Tesla’s Supercharger network in North America. Starting in June, owners of the Honda Prologue and Acura ZDX electric vehicles will be able to charge at Tesla’s stations. Those EVs are built with CCS charging ports […]

item.title: Gmail’s new AI search now sorts emails by relevance instead of chronological order
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google is rolling out a new Gmail update that is designed to help you find the email you’re looking for more quickly. The company announced on Thursday that it will now use AI to consider factors like recency, most-clicked emails, and frequent contacts when surfacing emails based on your search query. Up until now, Gmail […]

item.title: CoreWeave prices its IPO to raise at least $2.2 billion — and now the games begin
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: CoreWeave said on Wednesday that it hopes to sell its initial public shares between $47 and $55 per share, putting the money it may raise between about $2.2 billion and $2.6 billion. Word on the street is that CoreWeave wanted to raise at least $3 billion and possibly over $4 billion. But price range announcements […]

item.title: Anthropic adds web search to its Claude chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic’s AI-powered chatbot, Claude, can now search the web — a capability that had long eluded it. Web search is available now in preview for paid Claude users in the U.S., Anthropic said in its blog, with support for free users and additional countries coming soon. Users can toggle on web search in their profile […]

item.title: OpenAI upgrades its transcription and voice-generating AI models
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: OpenAI is bringing new transcription and voice-generating AI models to its API that the company claims improve upon its previous releases. For OpenAI, the models fit into its broader “agentic” vision: building automated systems that can independently accomplish tasks on behalf of users. The definition of “agent” might be in dispute, but OpenAI Head of […]

item.title: Threads adds new features to highlight topics and limit replies
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta’s social network Threads, an X competitor with more than 320 million monthly active users, is now rolling out new features related to topics, reply controls, and video playback in the app, among other things. It’s also making political content suggestions more personalized to the user, the company says. Combined, the features aim to make […]

item.title: Rerun’s open source AI platform for robots, drones, and cars revs up with $17M seed
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description: As generative AI moves increasingly into the physical world through robotics, vehicles, and drones, the need to map cloud-based AIs to real-world environments can lead to a huge mismatch. Rerun, a Stockholm-based dev tools startup, which builds a data stack for this emergent kind of “physical AI,” has secured $17 million in seed funding to […]

item.title: Bluesky makes it easier for publishers to track referrals
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Social network Bluesky, an open source X rival, has made a change that will allow publishers to better track the referral traffic originating from posts on its platform. According to a comment from Bluesky employee Emily Liu, the company is now sending referral traffic through Bluesky’s “go” subdomain to make it easier for publishers to […]
